wines.productName: Chateau Josephine Merlot  Mevushal (MD & DC) Stained Labels 2023
wines.description: An exceptional 2023 wine featuring herbs and red fruits. An outstanding example of its style and region.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with expressive aromas of cherry and chocolate, followed by elegant notes of herbs. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, rounded takes center stage, complemented by soft tannins and red fruits. The supple texture and refined structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The sustained finish is distinguished and medium, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.productName: Chateau Haut Peyrillat Bordeaux Left Bank 2020
wines.description: Representing the 2020 harvest, this offers dark chocolate and oak. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with alluring aromas of earth and floral, followed by refined notes of dark fruits. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, fruit-forward takes center stage, complemented by complex and balanced. The luxurious texture and structured structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The impressive finish is memorable and persistent, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.description: A remarkable 2023 bottling displaying blackberry and chocolate. A versatile wine that pairs beautifully with food.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with delicate aromas of blackberry and pepper, followed by pure notes of smoke. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, spicy takes center stage, complemented by dark fruits and chocolate. The silky texture and well-balanced structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The persistent finish is graceful and powerful, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.description: This 2020 expression showcases cedar and firm tannins. Perfect for current enjoyment or short-term cellaring.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with pronounced aromas of oak and earth, followed by complex notes of floral. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, balanced takes center stage, complemented by structured and fruit-forward. The velvety texture and harmonious structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The lingering finish is elegant and elegant, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.description: Crafted in 2023, this wine reveals tobacco and red fruits. A wine that balances tradition with modern winemaking.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with intense aromas of dried herbs and cherry, followed by layered notes of leather. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, earthy takes center stage, complemented by medium body and red fruits. The smooth texture and integrated structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The long finish is refined and long, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.description: A distinguished 2017 bottling that presents cinnamon and spicy. Ideal for both casual sipping and special occasions.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with subtle aromas of cinnamon and bramble, followed by nuanced notes of jammy berries. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, spicy takes center stage, complemented by full-bodied and bold. The polished texture and cohesive structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The extended finish is polished and warm, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.productName: Costers Del Segre Petit Sios Blanco 2021
wines.description: From the 2021 vintage, expect dark chocolate and oak. Represents excellent value for this quality level.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with vibrant aromas of earth and floral, followed by expressive notes of dark fruits. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, structured takes center stage, complemented by fruit-forward and complex. The refined texture and elegant structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The enduring finish is sophisticated and elegant, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.productName: Sun Break Marie-Paule Pinot Noir Open Claim Vineyard 2021
wines.description: This 2021 selection delivers cherry and silky. Shows the hallmark characteristics of its terroir.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with expressive aromas of cherry and raspberry, followed by elegant notes of earth. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, silky takes center stage, complemented by red fruits and spice. The supple texture and refined structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The sustained finish is distinguished and refined, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development

wines.description: Representing the 2022 harvest, this offers spice and medium body. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose opens with delicate aromas of red flowers and strawberry, followed by pure notes of raspberry. With time in the glass, additional layers emerge, adding depth and intrigue to the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, medium body takes center stage, complemented by warm alcohol and juicy. The silky texture and well-balanced structure create a compelling drinking experience that showcases both fruit purity and winemaking skill.
tastingNotes.finish: The persistent finish is graceful and soft, leaving a lasting impression. This wine demonstrates excellent character and will provide enjoyment for years to come.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030, with potential for further development
